summary:
D&D specifically said in the after the show interview that Jon and Dany are falling for each other. 
I wonder if sometimes they...
body:
D&D specifically said in the after the show interview that Jon and Dany are falling for each other.

I wonder if sometimes they tell you what the audience is supposed to be seeing like with Sansa, Arya, and Littlefinger?

Or I can accept that Jon and Dany have feelings for each other.

I think Dany seems way more in love than him. I think he is attracted to her. I think they both feel a connection because they are related and don’t know it yet. So they feel a connection to the dragons, and she sees Jon’s connection with Drogon. All of that adds up to feeling SOMETHING.

I still think Jon’s #1 priority is saving all of humanity - especially the North and especially his family - the Starks.

Jon also had complicated feelings for Ygritte (although it was much, much more apparent he loved her than it is with Dany). And while he built that relationship genuinely off a connection, he was also using that relationship to bolster his reputation with the free folk and fit in. It was all ultimately to gain info and attempt to kill Mance, and when the time was right he left the girl he loved, betrayed her, and went back to his duty, his brothers.

Jon has seen Dany do great things with her dragons - namely save him lol. He’s not seen the worst, but he has certainly imagined it and surmised what she’s done.

I think he wants to believe she has a good heart and will be a good ruler - better than Cersei. When she saves him, I think he gets caught up in that person & in the damsel in distress bit. She’s strong but now she’s crying and sad bc she lost a child. Jon likes being needed and he likes helping.

I don’t think it’s far-fetched for Jon to realize that having an emotional, romantic connection to Dany is going to help him politically, and I don’t think it’s far-fetched to imagine him betraying or leaving her for his true goal: to serve the North.

Ultimately I think this hits home with a huge reason why I don’t think Dany and Jon can be endgame. They have completely different goals. Dany wants to take the throne in KL and rule all seven kingdoms and some. She has no family. She only wants power and the seat that she believes is rightfully hers. Jon wants to protect his family. He belongs in the North. He doesn’t seek out power, and he definitely doesn’t think his birthright gives him anything.

Dany will want to be in the South in KL. And Jon would want to return home to WF.

Like in what world would they work out? For real? The only way is if one of them gives up who they are and what they want.

summary: All crows are liars
body:
All crows are liars

In episode 1.03 Lord Snow, old Nan is talking to Bran and says

All crows are liars.

Who else is a crow and could be a liar……

This made me think of Political Jon

In an episode heavy with conversations on family and loyalty from cersei telling Joffrey that their enemies is anyone who isn’t them to Ned telling Arya that the lone wolf dies. I think it’s clear the Stark’s are in truly in the great game now and will do whatever they need to do to ensure their survival.

Also interesting to note this is an episode where Dany is learning how to make drogo happy with her to essentially win him over….

Through sex……..

Boatbang anyone?!?!?!

And that’s my rambling for today….

summary: The Sansa Stark Appreciation Society
title: The Sansa Stark Appreciation Society
body:
read it on the AO3 at https://ift.tt/2NjhHZx

by blodeuweddbach

Second-year Literature student Sansa Stark finally achieves her goal of setting up the University of King’s Landing’s first ever Poetry Appreciation Society.

Too bad it only has one member, who doesn’t seem to even like poetry all that much.

summary: Warriors of Winterfell “This is the first time I’ve had armor. We had the idea of it being very protective and she buttons...
body:
Warriors of Winterfell

“This is the first time I’ve had armor. We had the idea of it being very protective and she buttons herself up. I wanted her to have a bit of armor and be a bit more warrior-like. She’s like the Warrior of Winterfell.” (Sophie Turner)

blog.name: paceyrememberseverything
blog.title: Erica
blog.description: Wife. Dog Mom. Proud Auntie & Godmother. Unapologetic fangirl and multi-shipping enthusiast! Sansa Stark is Queen 🐺

summary: Sansa’s Armour
body:
Sansa’s Armour

What’s the big deal with Sansa wearing some leather armour? She should take every precaution against the AOTD. EVERYBODY and their dog should have some kind of makeshift armour.

Her donning some armour does NOT change who she is, she’s knows who she is, she’s not trying to change herself to appease someone else’s beliefs. She’s wearing some damn armour, that gives her some inner strength, how can that be wrong?! We know Brienne will fight for her, she wields the weapons.


Sure, a lady’s greatest armour is her courtesy and Sansa is one of the best at wielding that

BUT

Sansa using courtesy against a bunch of mindless white walkers isn’t going to do sweet f*ck all to help her survive, now is it?!

So yeah, I’m all for Sansa wearing her leather armour, I want to see her putting it on, taking a deep breath, looking at herself in the mirror and saying “I am the blood of Winterfell, I must be as strong as my Lady Mother. I will survive this!”

summary: In Whatever Time We Have
title: In Whatever Time We Have
body:
Written for day 8 of @jonxsansafanfiction Love Songs based on the song “In Whatever Time We Have” from the musical Children of Eden

The army of the death is marching upon Winterfell and Jon knows that the time has come to fight or die. But before he can face death, there are a few things he has to confess. And they’re all about Sansa.

Canon Divergence / Canon Compliant

He felt it. He didn’t know how and he didn’t know why, but he felt it. He felt it in his bones. He felt it in his soul. He felt it in his heart.

They were coming.

The army of the death was coming.

They could be here tomorrow. They could be here in a few days or a week. But they were coming and there was no one to stop them.

No one but them.

“It’s time.” Jon took a deep breath and stood up from his seat. He straightened his back and lifted his chin. He still wasn’t used to being king, but he had watched Ned and hoped that looking as much like him as possible would be enough. “The white walkers are marching upon us and we are all that stands between them and Westeros.” He spoke slowly. “Right now it’s not about who will end up on the iron throne. It’s simply about who will survive.”

There was nothing but absolute silence, but when he looked at Sansa, sitting firmly on his right, she nodded.

“Tonight love your husbands, love your wives and kiss your children goodnight. Tomorrow we’ll show the death what we’re made of.”

The crowd in front of him started cheering and Jon felt the adrenaline rushing through his veins. Maybe he wasn’t used to being a king, but he was used to fight and to command an army. He could do this. He would do this.

“Winter is coming, but the North will endure!” Jon raised his voice. “For Winterfell!” He let his glance wander over all the people who had pledged their loyalty to him while they left the great hall to enjoy their possible last day on earth.

And only when there was nothing but utter silence and he and Sansa were the only ones left he fell down in his seat and allowed the weight of the upcoming war to crush him.

“Jon…” Sansa placed a hand on his. Her touch was gentle and light and her voice was soothing. “You should take your own advice and spend time with the people you love tonight, saying goodbye.” She almost choked on the last word and Jon’s hand went through his dark black curls.

“I know.” He’d have to say goodbye to Sam, to Bran, to Arya. He’d have to say goodbye to Sansa. He’d have to say much more to Sansa. It could be his very last chance. Maybe he would die tomorrow, or next week, or somewhere in between. Maybe he could never tell her anymore.

But he didn’t know where to start. He had never been much of a talker, not when it came to his wishes, longings and feelings. He had never been much of a talker when it came to love.

But he wasn’t the only one who didn’t move.

“Jon?” Sansa was the first to break the silence. “I know that I wasn’t always nice to you when we were kids.” Her lips curled up into a sad smile. “But you’re an amazing king. Father, Robb…” She hesitated for a moment. “They would be really proud of you and how far you’ve come.”

He glanced at the girl next to him, speaking as if they were not children simply pretending to be kings and queens. “It will all be pointless if we lose.”

“No, it won’t.” Sansa firmly shook her head and she tightened her grip on his hand, which she was still holding. “The last years have been hard, yes, but there have been nice moments too.” Her smile brightened. “And I’m glad I was here to see you become the amazing leader you are now.”

“I couldn’t have done it without you, Sansa.”

Without her he would have been dead. He wouldn’t have had the courage to march on Winterfell. He would have lost the battle against Ramsay. He wouldn’t have won the trust of the North. He wouldn’t have been able to tell everyone about the true war that was coming.

“And I’m glad I didn’t have to.” He added and swallowed. “You’ve always been beautiful, but I hope that by now you know that you’re so much more than that. You’re smart. You’re brave. You’re strong.” He treaded on dangerous ground, but he realised he had not much to lose. “And if there had been more time, I would have asked you if there was maybe a part of you that could love me.”

“O, Jon…” Sansa let out a deep sigh and then she pressed the palms of her hands to his cheeks. “There is not a part of me that doesn’t love you.” She locked her glance with his and then she leaned in to kiss him.

At first her kiss was soft and tender, but then he wrapped his arms around her and parted his lips.

They forgot where they were. They forgot who they were. They forgot the time.

And minutes, or hours, later, when they were both out of breath and their lips were red and swollen they pulled back and realised that every second that passed was one more second closer to what could be the end.

“Let me go with you.” Sansa bit her lip. “I know I can’t fight as well as you or Arya. But I can’t stand the thought of staying behind, not knowing who will come knocking on my door. You or the army of the death.” She kissed him again. “And if these are our last days on earth, I want to spend them with you.”

And despite the war that was coming, despite death waiting for them around the corner, despite the lack of promises if there would ever be a tomorrow, Jon felt himself smiling. “I won’t leave your side until the last bit of air leaves my body. It doesn’t matter if that’s tomorrow, next week or in a hundred years.” He tucked a strand of hair behind her ear. “I’m gonna spend the rest of my life with you, starting with tonight.” He stood up from his seat and stretched out his hand.

With a smile Sansa placed her hand in his and a small scream escaped her lips when he lifted her up and carried her towards her bedroom.
body_abstract:
Written for day 8 of @jonxsansafanfiction Love Songs based on the song “In Whatever Time We Have” from the musical Children of Eden

The army of the death is marching upon Winterfell and Jon knows that the time has come to fight or die. But before he can face death, there are a few things he has to confess. And they’re all about Sansa.

Canon Divergence / Canon Compliant

He felt it. He didn’t know how and he didn’t know why, but he felt it. He felt it in his bones. He felt it in his soul. He felt it in his heart.

They were coming.

The army of the death was coming.

They could be here tomorrow. They could be here in a few days or a week. But they were coming and there was no one to stop them.

No one but them.

“It’s time.” Jon took a deep breath and stood up from his seat. He straightened his back and lifted his chin. He still wasn’t used to being king, but he had watched Ned and hoped that looking as much like him as possible would be enough. “The white walkers are marching upon us and we are all that stands between them and Westeros.” He spoke slowly. “Right now it’s not about who will end up on the iron throne. It’s simply about who will survive.”

There was nothing but absolute silence, but when he looked at Sansa, sitting firmly on his right, she nodded.

“Tonight love your husbands, love your wives and kiss your children goodnight. Tomorrow we’ll show the death what we’re made of.”

The crowd in front of him started cheering and Jon felt the adrenaline rushing through his veins. Maybe he wasn’t used to being a king, but he was used to fight and to command an army. He could do this. He would do this.

“Winter is coming, but the North will endure!” Jon raised his voice. “For Winterfell!” He let his glance wander over all the people who had pledged their loyalty to him while they left the great hall to enjoy their possible last day on earth.

blog.title: sansa stark & sandor clegane are soulmates

tags: a song of ice and fire
summary: “Do you want to go home?”
body:
“Do you want to go home?”

In my dreams, Sansa’s reaction to seeing the Hound again is a kiss on the mouth and the statement “Welcome home.”

Because she’s his wife and his home is with her, see?

blog.name: thequeeninthenorthh
blog.title: the Queen in the North
blog.description: Game of Thrones✨House Stark loyalist, member of the Sansa Stark defence squad and deep believer in Jonsa🐺❄️

summary: I’m sorry buuuuuut people out there really having a problem with Sansa wearing armour?? Um, so just because she’s not a warrior...
body: I’m sorry buuuuuut people out there really having a problem with Sansa wearing armour?? Um, so just because she’s not a warrior like Arya and Brienne, she’s not aloud to protect herself? I think I must be deluded because, I seem to recall Missandei wearing armour but I haven’t seen her have any skills with a sword?? Or is it because a lot people refuse to believe that Sansa is no longer a willowy creature in a tower but now in fact one of the most formidable political warriors in the show???? Don’t even get me started on Cersei. It’s okay for Cersei to wear armour in her dress in season 2, just to sit in a tower with women getting progressively drunk?? Also in season 3 she says to Maergery: “You might find a bit of armour useful when you become queen, perhaps even before” Isn’t it possible she could have perhaps said the same thing to Sansa at one point? Considering Sansa “Learnt a great deal” from Cersei. All this aside, why shouldn’t Sansa have a gown with some armour? She believes Jon when he says the dead are coming, but she’s also aware that enemies could be anywhere around her. So if people could educate themselves it’d be GREAT, I’m sick of Sansa being undermined for such minor things that other females characters would get appraised for. It’s the ignorance that stems from seeing Sansa as that annoying 11 year old and not how much she’s progressed into a strong leader, despite lacking skills at swordplay.

Or is it because a lot people refuse to believe that Sansa is no longer a willowy creature in a tower but now in fact one of the most formidable political warriors in the show???? Don’t even get me started on Cersei. It’s okay for Cersei to wear armour in her dress in season 2, just to sit in a tower with women getting progressively drunk?? Also in season 3 she says to Maergery: “You might find a bit of armour useful when you become queen, perhaps even before” Isn’t it possible she could have perhaps said the same thing to Sansa at one point? Considering Sansa “Learnt a great deal” from Cersei. All this aside, why shouldn’t Sansa have a gown with some armour? She believes Jon when he says the dead are coming, but she’s also aware that enemies could be anywhere around her. So if people could educate themselves it’d be GREAT, I’m sick of Sansa being undermined for such minor things that other females characters would get appraised for. It’s the ignorance that stems from seeing Sansa as that annoying 11 year old and not how much she’s progressed into a strong leader, despite lacking skills at swordplay.
trail.content: I’m sorry buuuuuut people out there really having a problem with Sansa wearing armour?? Um, so just because she’s not a warrior like Arya and Brienne, she’s not aloud to protect herself? I think I must be deluded because, I seem to recall Missandei wearing armour but I haven’t seen her have any skills with a sword?? Or is it because a lot people refuse to believe that Sansa is no longer a willowy creature in a tower but now in fact one of the most formidable political warriors in the show???? Don’t even get me started on Cersei. It’s okay for Cersei to wear armour in her dress in season 2, just to sit in a tower with women getting progressively drunk?? Also in season 3 she says to Maergery: “You might find a bit of armour useful when you become queen, perhaps even before” Isn’t it possible she could have perhaps said the same thing to Sansa at one point? Considering Sansa “Learnt a great deal” from Cersei. All this aside, why shouldn’t Sansa have a gown with some armour? She believes Jon when he says the dead are coming, but she’s also aware that enemies could be anywhere around her. So if people could educate themselves it’d be GREAT, I’m sick of Sansa being undermined for such minor things that other females characters would get appraised for. It’s the ignorance that stems from seeing Sansa as that annoying 11 year old and not how much she’s progressed into a strong leader, despite lacking skills at swordplay.

summary: LEAKED Betrayal of Sansa Stark! Game Of Thrones Season 8 (Leaked Scenes)
title: LEAKED Betrayal of Sansa Stark! Game Of Thrones Season 8 (Leaked Scenes)
excerpt: Sansa was taught to always think three steps ahead of her enemies. One of the biggest questions a lot of us have going into Game Of Thrones Season 8 is; How ...
description: Oh dear God! Make it stop!!! Now “fan theory” has become “official leaks.” Why they HELL would Sansa NEED to betray the family she just spent the last 7 seasons TRYING to get back to underneath the roof of Winterfell? Why bother saying, “the lone wolf dies, but the pack survives???”
